identificationModule.briefTitle: Gastrointestinal And Metabolic Effects From a Prebiotic, Lifting, and Aerobic iNtervention
identificationModule.officialTitle: Gastrointestinal And Metabolic Effects From a Prebiotic, Lifting, and Aerobic iNtervention (GAMEPLAN)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to determine the independent and combined effects of prebiotic fiber supplementation and exercise on the gut microbiome and human health.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: The study is a randomized, controlled trial with a 6-week intervention period with two groups: 1) Exercise + Prebiotic and 2) Exercise + Placebo.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The study is a double-blind, placebo-controlled study.

armGroups.label: Exercise + Prebiotic
armGroups.description: The Exercise + Prebiotic intervention group will consume 10 g/d of fructo-oligosaccharides (FOS). Additionally, they will perform 6 wk. of supervised progressive multi-component exercise training consisting of moderate to vigorous aerobic and strength-based exercises (3x/wk).

armGroups.label: Exercise + Placebo
armGroups.description: The Exercise + Placebo group will consume 10 g/d of a placebo (maltodextrin) powder every day. Additionally, they will perform 6 wk. of supervised progressive multi-component exercise training consisting of moderate to vigorous aerobic and strength-based exercises (3x/wk).

interventions.name: Fructooligosaccharides (FOS)
interventions.description: FOS (NUTRAFLORA® P-95, Ingredion) supplements (10g/day) will be consumed daily mixed with water.

interventions.name: Exercise
interventions.description: During the intervention period, all participants will perform 6 weeks of supervised progressive multi-component exercise training consisting of moderate to vigorous aerobic and strength-based exercises (3x/wk.).

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Maltodextrin (Globe 18DE Maltodextrin, Ingredion) supplements (10g/day) will be consumed daily mixed with water.

primaryOutcomes.description: Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on the gastrointestinal microbiota compared to control by sequencing the V4 region of the 16S rRNA gene in fecal samples.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in gastrointestinal microbial-derived metabolite concentrations
primaryOutcomes.description: Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on the concentration of short-chain fatty acids compared to control.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on fasting glucose compared to control.
Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on fasting insulin compared to control.
Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on body composition compared to control. This includes percentage of fat mass and lean mass.

Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on body fat distribution compared to control. This includes the weight of visceral fat and liver fat in kilograms.

Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on relational memory, hippocampal function, interference control, and selective attention compared to control. Outcomes will be assessed with computer tasks and participants will be equipped with an electrode cap.

otherOutcomes.description: Determine the impact of daily consumption of prebiotic combined with regular exercise on fasting lipid profiles including cholesterol and triglycerides compared to control.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* BMI 18.5-45 kg/m2
* Without physician diagnosed gastrointestinal or metabolic diseases
* Sedentary (\< 30 minutes of moderate or high intensity exercise per week OR \< 20 aggregate Godin-Shepard Leisure Time Physical Activity Questionnaire (GSLTQ; GodinLeisure) score)
* Fully vaccinated against COVID-19

Exclusion Criteria:

* Fasting blood glucose \>126 mg/dL
* Blood pressure \>160/100 mm Hg
* Physician diagnosed metabolic or gastrointestinal diseases or constipation
* Heart conditions that may pose risk during exercise
* Taking oral hypoglycemic agents or insulin
* Pregnant, breastfeeding or postmenopausal
* Smoke or consume \> 2 alcoholic beverages/day, abuse drugs
* Have had \> 5% weight change in the past month or \> 10% change in the past year
* Have had any form of bariatric surgery or gallbladder removal
* Have taken antibiotics during the previous 3 months
* Unable to consume the experimental fiber
